text: That works great thanks !
What would be best approach to find a deal by deal name ?
Sorry really new to this
Looking at using v1 at the moment

<@U018FJJB2PL> i never use the deal part for the moment try this
```$hubSpot = \HubSpot\Factory::createWithApiKey('api-key');
$filter  = new \HubSpot\Client\Crm\Deals\Model\Filter();
$filter
    ->setOperator('EQ')
    ->setPropertyName('name')
    ->setValue($search);

$filterGroup = new \HubSpot\Client\Crm\Deals\Model\FilterGroup();
$filterGroup->setFilters([$filter]);

$searchRequest = new \HubSpot\Client\Crm\Deals\Model\PublicObjectSearchRequest();
$searchRequest->setFilterGroups([$filterGroup]);
$dealsPage = $hubSpot->crm()->deals()->searchApi()->doSearch($searchRequest);```
I’m not sure it will work make the test

Does anyone know when the functionality for creating and updating quotes through the CRM API will be released?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/quotes>

Hi, I'm preparing an application for generating product pages. The application is created locally (Vue.js) and runs at localhost: 8080. Based on the collected data(HubDB API), I'm trying to create a page using the Page API (of course I have created an API key): <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pages/post_pages> but unfortunately, there is a bug related to CORS policy. Is there a workaround for this bug? Maybe some chrome extension?

The query works when it made from the console from the site <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/overview> but this is not an ideal solution for me.
```<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/engagements-overview#email-content>```
2 doors!  that was very generous of you!  i would have just ignored it if it was that many

Hello everyone !! This is my first message post, hopefully I get some responses.  :slightly_smiling_face:
I have a workflow webhook created and have verified the the request is coming through. The request has signature header for v2 ( X-HubSpot-Signature-Version: v2 ). When I calculate the hash with secret, method, uri, requestbody , the computed signature does not match the one sent in the header (X-HubSpot-Signature).
For the WebHook what APP ID and Secret do I need to use ? Do I *have to* create a new APP for using a WebHook in order to obtain an APP ID and secret ?
Can someone please point me the correct direction to proceed further with this issue ?
<@UN72NHVRA> I haven't been able to find any updates on when the subscription preferences api is going to be generally released. Is that happening soon?
Hi Mack, we should see an announcement for GA in the next couple of weeks!

adding this fixed it:

```var jsonString = JSON.stringify(body);```
and then passing jsonString as body
